intro: Pilosella floribunda subsp. anomelana, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in dense, fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Asteraceae family, particularly within the tribe Cichorieae.
